_**Chrisley Knows Best**_ is an American [reality
television](/wiki/Reality_television "Reality television") series airing on
the [USA Network](/wiki/USA_Network "USA Network"). It centers around the
lives of wealthy Georgia real estate mogul Todd Chrisley and his
family.[1][2][3] The show formerly took place in
[Roswell](/wiki/Roswell,_Georgia "Roswell, Georgia") and [Alpharetta,
Georgia](/wiki/Alpharetta,_Georgia "Alpharetta, Georgia"), both near
[Atlanta](/wiki/Atlanta "Atlanta").[1] The show is currently in its fifth
season, which was filmed mainly in [Nashville,
Tennessee](/wiki/Nashville,_Tennessee "Nashville, Tennessee"). In the summer
of 2017, it was announced that a sixth season of _Chrisley Knows Best_ would
air.[4]

## Cast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chrisley_Knows_Best&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Cast")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Todd_and_Savannah_Chrisley_interviewed_by_RumorFix.jpg/220px-
Todd_and_Savannah_Chrisley_interviewed_by_RumorFix.jpg)](/wiki/File:Todd_and_Savannah_Chrisley_interviewed_by_RumorFix.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Todd_and_Savannah_Chrisley_interviewed_by_RumorFix.jpg
"Enlarge")

Todd and Savannah Chrisley interviewed by [RumorFix](/wiki/RumorFix
"RumorFix") at [KIIS-FM](/wiki/KIIS-FM "KIIS-FM")'s Jingle Ball 2014.

  * **Todd Chrisley** , a father who has made all of his money in real estate. He can sometimes get quite angry, especially at his son Chase. He is a [germophobe](/wiki/Mysophobia "Mysophobia") and tries to avoid things like dirt and animals.
  * **Julie Chrisley** , Todd's wife. She enjoys cooking.
  * **Chloe Chrisley** , Todd's infant granddaughter, she did not appear after the Chrisleys moved to Nashville
  * **Kyle Chrisley** , Chloe's father. Kyle has previously had a drug problem, and did not appear outside of the first season.
  * **Lindsie Chrisley Campbell** , Todd's daughter with Therese, and mother of Jackson.
  * **Chase Chrisley** , Todd and Julie's son. He is often made fun of and humiliated by Todd. Chase and his friend Parker are often up to some sort of mischief that they think will get them rich. He is a germophobe, like Todd.
  * **Savannah Chrisley** , Todd and Julie's daughter, a [beauty pageant](/wiki/Beauty_pageant "Beauty pageant") competitor. She often gets in car crashes, which once resulted in her not getting a new car.
  * **Grayson Chrisley** , Todd and Julie's youngest child. Grayson will often do things to make Todd mad, like opening up a can of pop without Todd's permission.
  * **Jackson Campbell** , the son of Lindsie and her husband, Will, from whom she is separated.
  * **Faye Chrisley** , Todd's mother. Faye enjoys to just stay home most of the time. She used to live with a woman named Catherine, who passed away in 2016 at the age of 96.

##
Production[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chrisley_Knows_Best&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Production")]

The series is executive produced by Adam Greener, Jim Sayer, and Stephanie
Chambers.[5] Maverick TV and [All3Media America](/wiki/All3Media "All3Media")
are the production companies behind the series.[6] On April 14, 2014, the USA
Network ordered a 12-episode second season of _Chrisley Knows Best_.[7] It is
also USA Network's youngest-skewing[_[clarification
needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Please_clarify "Wikipedia:Please clarify")_] original
series.[7] On October 20, 2014, the series was renewed for a 12-episode third
season.[8] On February 5, 2015, the episode order was increased by 6 episodes
for a total of 18 for season 3.[9] On July 7, 2016, USA renewed the show for a
fifth season. That same day, the network announced that the second half of
season 4 will premiere in August bringing it to a total of 26 episodes. On
July 25th, 2017, a sixth season was picked up of Chrisley Knows Best, and on
that same day it was confirmed that Season 5 will start back airing on
September 12, 2017, and a sixth season will begin filming in November 2017.

##
Reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chrisley_Knows_Best&action=edit&section=11
"Edit section: Reception")]

The show has received mixed reviews. Tom Gliatto of
_[People](/wiki/People_\(magazine\) "People \(magazine\)")_ gave the show a
rating of 75% and gave a positive review, saying "This is the best 'family'
reality series since _Honey Boo Boo_ or even _The Osbournes_ from several eons
ago".[79] Hillary Busis of _[Entertainment Weekly](/wiki/Entertainment_Weekly
"Entertainment Weekly")_ gave a mixed review, saying "If you can get past the
canned lines and sub-sitcom storylines, the Chrisley crew can be fun".[79]
Brian Lowry of _[Variety](/wiki/Variety_\(magazine\) "Variety \(magazine\)")_
gave a mixed review, saying "As intriguing in the details as it is
uncomfortable to watch, 'Chrisley Knows Best,' a self-consciously sitcom-like
reality show, initially seems to be just another knockoff designed to cash in
on the 'Duck Dynasty' demo. Cut through the deep-fried window dressing,
though, and this USA series is almost entirely devoted to its
[subtext](/wiki/Subtext "Subtext"), intended to elicit sniggering regarding
[that which goes unsaid](/wiki/Closeted "Closeted") about the show's wealthy
father of five, whom his son-in-law understandably dubs
'[flamboyant](/wiki/Effeminacy "Effeminacy").' Played as epic farce, the skein
should have a disparate range of appeal, but let's hope the Chrisleys don't
mind being laughed at, not with".[80]

## Broadcast and
streaming[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chrisley_Knows_Best&action=edit&section=12
"Edit section: Broadcast and streaming")]

_Chrisley Knows Best_ is broadcast on [USA Network](/wiki/USA_Network "USA
Network") in the United States. In the UK, it airs on [ITVBe](/wiki/ITVBe
"ITVBe").
